title: Biden names a Border Patrol veteran in Texas to be the agency's next chief
description: Jason Owens, the head of a busy Border Patrol sector in Del Rio, Texas, will lead the agency, the Biden administration announced. His predecessor is retiring at the end of the month.

title: Jack Smith, special counsel in classified documents case, defends his work
description: After unsealing the indictment against former President Donald Trump, Smith said the indictment was an important step for keeping the United States safe and protecting democracy. See his full remarks.

title: Boris Johnson quits Parliament after learning he will be sanctioned over 'partygate'
description: The former prime minister quit as a lawmaker after receiving the results of an investigation over misleading statements he made to Parliament about a series of government parties during the pandemic.

title: Florida families face confusion after gender-affirming care ban temporarily blocked
description: This week, a judge temporarily blocked Florida's ban on gender-affirming care for kids. It's seen as a win for trans rights but a chilling effect has left some providers and families confused on care.

title: These are the charges Trump was indicted on and what they mean
description: The Justice Department special counsel has unsealed the indictment against the former president. The 37 charges against Trump include obstruction and unlawful retention of defense information.

title: Texas plans a floating barrier in the Rio Grande. Here's what we know about it
description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott announced a $1 million string of buoys along the river that divides Texas and Mexico — and more may be installed in the future.

title: Pickleball has a noise problem. He's trying to fix it
description: Pickleball is America's fastest growing sport, but it has a noise problem. One man is on a mission to fix that.

title: The judge assigned to oversee Trump's criminal case was appointed by Trump himself
description: Judge Aileen Cannon was appointed to the bench by Trump in 2020. She ruled in favor of Trump's request to appoint a special master to review documents seized by the FBI in Florida last summer.

title: James Watt, sharp-tongued interior secretary under Reagan, dies at 85
description: The Reagan administration's sharp-tongued, pro-development interior secretary was beloved by conservatives but ran afoul of environmentalists. Watt even managed to offend Beach Boys fans.

title: Here's how NPR reporters around the world are dealing with air pollution
description: As Canada and parts of the U.S. confront declines in air quality due to smoke from Canadian wildfires, NPR reporters in Asia, Latin America and Africa share their experiences.

title: Here's one route where immigration has slowed since Biden's new U.S. border rules
description: A popular immigration passageway saw a drop right when the U.S. passed new rules imposing criminal prosecution and requiring proof an asylum-seeker was previously denied in another country.

title: Relationships are the true heart of 1940s dystopian novel 'Kallocain'
description: Karin Boye's novel is an outlier in that it was authored by a woman and, though narrated by a man, still expresses interest in women's inner life and acknowledges the subtleties of sexism.

title: 'All the Sinners Bleed' elegantly walks a fine line between horror and crime fiction
description: S.A. Cosby's latest is a dark, wildly entertaining crime novel with religious undertones — and one that tackles timely issues while never losing itself or sounding preachy.

title: Blankets of orange haze may be unwelcomed guests at weddings this weekend in the U.S.
description: Christina Lamoureux planned a perfect wedding. Now she is among the unlucky set of soon-to-be married couples franticly making contingency plans as clouds of polluted air linger over their nuptials.

title: 4 things to think about when it comes to the politics of Trump's indictment
description: Former President Donald Trump has been indicted by the Department of Justice while he seeks the presidency again. The unprecedented nature raises political questions for 2024 and beyond.

title: Kevin McCarthy survived his first political battle. This is how his hometown reacted
description: The debt ceiling debate ultimately ended with a deal between congressional Republicans and the White House. In Bakersfield, Calif., Speaker Kevin McCarthy's constituents watched the debate unfold.

title: Court ruling on Black political power in Alabama could affect maps in other states
description: A major Supreme Court decision in an Alabama redistricting case could provide a roadmap for other gerrymandering challenges. There are similar challenges to maps elsewhere in the South.

title: What is there a shortage of? Find out in the NPR news quiz (hint: it's not smoke)
description: From Barbie to Messi to Rishi Sunak, a lot happened this week. How well were you paying attention?

title: A former North Korean operative gives his first interview since defecting in 2014
description: Kim Hyun-woo used to work for North Korea's top intelligence agency. He defected to South Korea in 2014 and is now on his first-ever visit to the United States.

title: Staying safe in smoky air is particularly important for some people. Here's how
description: Much of the Northeast U.S. is blanketed in a murky haze of wildfire smoke. For most people breathing this air is unpleasant, for others it can be life-threatening. There are ways to reduce the risk.

title: America is going through an oil boom – and this time it's different
description: Business is pretty good in America's busiest oil patch. Prices are high enough to turn a profit and then some. But instead of going wild, producers have been aiming for something new: Discipline.

title: 3 lessons from the Western U.S. for dealing with wildfire smoke
description: Living with unhealthy wildfire smoke is becoming more common across the country. Western states have learned some key lessons in how to deal with it.

title: An eating disorders chatbot offered dieting advice, raising fears about AI in health
description: The National Eating Disorders Association took down a controversial chatbot, after users showed how the newest version could dispense potentially harmful advice about dieting and calorie counting.

title: Kangaroo care gets a major endorsement. Here's what it looks like in Ivory Coast
description: A new study looks at the reduction in mortality among vulnerable babies if kangaroo care — skin-to-skin contact — is started soon after birth.
